tagDescription: Correspondence leading to the 1909 Imperial Defence Conference; notes taken to the conference, including research and memoranda by Rear Admiral C.E. Kingsmill
Questions by Rear Admiral C.E. Kingsmill and answers by the Admiralty concerning the Canadian Navy

Correspondence with various branches of the Canadian Navy League regarding a Canadian Navy; Navy league Journal, Vol. x., No. 6, June 1905. Principal correspondents: H.J. Wickham C. Phillipps-Wolley H.F. Wyatt
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
La Verite sur la Question de la Question de la Defense navale; correspondance concernant la distribution de cette brochure en la province du Quebec

Articles by Charles Tupper in The Nineteenth Century and After and Stephen Leacock in The University Magazine, press and interview quotation, charts, tables, Resolution of 1909 and other printed material used in preparing Brodeur's speech introducing the Naval Bill
Brief Sketch of Canadian Affairs 1838 Hastily Drawn on board H.M.S. VESTAL by Dr. Wolfred Nelson and Robert Shore Milnes Bouchette. (original and transcription)

Notated working papers of the 1909 Imperial Defence Conference; correspondence regarding conference resolutions and the possibility of a Canadian Navy; draft resolutions. Principal correspondent: W. Laurier
Extract fron the London Times on the 1907 conference; October and November 1907 copies of the British Empire Review; speech given by Brodeur to the Empire Club
Correspondence regarding the purchase of ships for the Canadian Navy. Principal correspondents: W. Laurier A.B. Aylesworth Lord grey
Notes preparees par Hector S. Huot pour Vital Tetu sur la periode 1837-1838. (originaux)
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
Correspondence between the Colonial Office and the Governor of Bermuda and documents from the Royal Gazette, Bermuda, pertaining to the exiles of the rebellion of 1837-1838. (transcription)
Seven sequentially numbered and notated drafts of the Naval Bill, two of which are in galley form
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
Extracts from Proceedings of Colonial Conferences relating to Defence (1887 to 1907)
Notes and documents used to prepare Brodeur's speech to the 1907 Colonial Conference; printed minutes of 23 April and 7 May 1907 fron that conference
Brodeur's draft speech to introduce the Naval Bill
Tentative index for L.-P. Brodeur papers prepared by his son, Rear Admiral Victor Gabriel Brodeur

Eight sequentially numbered and notated drafts of the Naval Bill; comments on Naval Bill by Rear Admiral C.E. Kingsmill; Discours du Tres Hon. Sir Wilfrid Laurier, G.C.M.G., M.P. sur la defense Navale du Canada (3 fevrier 1910)
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
Correspondence et recherche de Brodeur au sujet de la rebellion de 1837-1838 et de l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
Press clippings discussing the possibility of a Canadian Navy
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.

Confidential Papers laid before the Imperial Defence Conference, 1909; Proceeding of the Imperial Conference on Naval and Military Defence (28 July to 19 August 1909); Conference with Representatives of the Self-Governing Dominions on the Naval and Military Defence of the Empire 1909
La rebellion de 1837-1838 et l'inhumation de Pierre Lambert.
